programme.desc: We revisit the opening match of Euro 96 as England took on Group A rivals Switzerland at Wembley. Alan Shearer was looking to end his 12-game international scoring drought.(n)

programme.title: Euro 96
programme.desc: We revisit the opening Group B match of Euro 96 as Spain faced Bulgaria at Elland Road. A fiery second half saw both sides end the game with ten men.(n)

programme.title: Euro 96
programme.desc: We revisit the opening Group C clash at Euro 96 as Germany took on Czech Republic at Old Trafford. Pre-tournament favorites Germany were missing the suspended Jurgen Klinsmann.(n)

programme.title: Euro 96
programme.desc: We revisit the opening Group D clash at Euro 96 between Denmark and Portugal at Hillsborough. Holders Denmark faced Portugal's golden generation, including Luis Figo and Rui Costa.(n)

programme.title: Euro 96
programme.desc: We revisit Scotland's opening match of Euro 96 against Group A rivals Netherlands at Villa Park. Craig Brown's team face a Dutch side featuring Edgar Davids and Dennis Bergkamp.(n)

programme.title: Euro 96
programme.desc: We revisit the Euro 96 clash as Romania faced Group B rivals France at St James' Park. This talented Romania side had reached the FIFA World Cup quarter-finals two years earlier.(n)

programme.title: Euro 96
programme.desc: We revisit Italy's opening match of Euro 96 as they faced Group C rivals Russia at Anfield. A talented Italian side featured Gianfranco Zola, Paolo Maldini and Roberto Donadoni.(n)

programme.title: Euro 96
programme.desc: We revisit the Euro 96 clash between Group D rivals Turkey and Croatia at the City Ground. A talented Croatia side featured Davor Suker and current West Ham manager Slaven Bilic.(n)

programme.title: Euro 96
programme.desc: We revisit the Euro 96 clash between Group A rivals Switzerland and Netherlands at Villa Park. A talented Dutch side featured Dennis Bergkamp, Clarence Seedorf and Danny Blind.(n)

programme.title: Euro 96
programme.desc: We revisit the Euro 96 clash between Group B rivals Bulgaria and Romania at St James' Park. Hristo Stoichkov yet again proved to be an inspirational figure for the Bulgarians.(n)

programme.title: Euro 96
programme.desc: We revisit the Euro 96 clash between Group C rivals Czech Republic and Italy at Anfield. Italy were made to pay for resting star players Alessandro Del Piero and Gianfranco Zola.(n)

programme.title: Euro 96
programme.desc: We revisit the Euro 96 clash between Group D rivals Portugal and Turkey at the City Ground. The Turks, spearheaded by Hakan Sukur, needed to win to avoid an early exit.(n)

programme.title: Euro 96
programme.desc: We revisit the Battle of Britain clash between Group A rivals England and Scotland at Wembley. The match saw Paul Gascoigne score one of the most iconic goals in recent history.(n)

programme.title: Euro 96
programme.desc: We revisit the Euro 96 clash between Group B rivals France and Spain at Elland Road. The French side featured a young Zinedine Zidane who partnered Didier Deschamps in midfield.(n)

programme.title: Euro 96
programme.desc: We revisit the Euro 96 clash between Group C rivals Russia and Germany at Old Trafford. Jurgen Klinsmann returned from suspension to help fire the Germans into the last eight.(n)

programme.title: Euro 96
programme.desc: We revisit the Euro 96 clash between Group D rivals Croatia and Denmark at Hillsborough, featuring Davor Suker's chip Peter Schmeichel, one of the tournament's most iconic moments.(n)

programme.title: Euro 96
programme.desc: We revisit the Euro 96 clash between Group A rivals Scotland and Switzerland at Villa Park. The Scots needed a win and a shift in the group's goal difference in order to progress.(n)

programme.title: Euro 96
programme.desc: We revisit the Euro 96 clash between Group A rivals England and the Netherlands at Wembley. A swashbuckling England display saw them produce one of their finest ever performances.(n)

programme.desc: We revisit the Euro 96 clash between Group B rivals France and Bulgaria at St James' Park. A star-studded French lineup included Zinedine Zidane, Laurent Blanc and Marcel Desailly.(n)

programme.desc: We revisit the Euro 96 clash between Group B rivals Romania and Spain at Elland Road. Javier Clemente's side needed a victory to secure progress into the knockout stages.(n)

programme.desc: We revisit the Euro 96 clash between Group C rivals Italy and Germany at Old Trafford. Italy needed to better the result of the Czech's match against Russia in order to progress.(n)

programme.desc: We revisit the Euro 96 clash between Group D rivals Croatia and Portugal at the City Ground. A star-studded Portuguese lineup included Luis Figo, Rui Costa and Paulo Sousa.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2016
programme.desc: Action from day one at the All England Club, which saw defending men's champion Novak Djokovic begin his campaign on Centre Court.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2016 - Live
programme.desc: Coverage of the second day's play at the All England Club, with the first round in the men's and ladies' singles set to continue. Weather permitting, the line-up for the second round will be decided by the end of the day, and one of the most anticipated moments of today's schedule is the start of Andy Murray's campaign. The British number one lost in the semi-finals here last year as he succumbed to one of the most outstanding performances of Roger Federer's career, ending his chances of winning the title for the second time. Murray began in 2015 with a very useful workout against Mikhail Kukushkin, being tested in all three sets before securing a 6-4, 7-6, 6-4 win, while Federer also won in straight sets against Damir Dzumhur. While those two enjoyed relatively serene progress, there were defeats in the ladies' draw for former runner-up Eugenie Bouchard and third seed Simona Halep, while British duo Laura Robson and Kyle Edmund also exited.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2016 - Live
programme.desc: Coverage of the third day's play at the All England Club, with the men's and ladies' singles second-round matches scheduled to fill the famous grass courts. British star Heather Watson enjoyed one of the most significant victories of her career here in round two last year as she defeated Daniela Hantuchova in straight sets, which set up a thrilling last-32 clash against Serena Williams. The world number one lost just five games in her win over Timea Babos, but seventh seed Ana Ivanovic was not so fortunate, as she tumbled out of the tournament with a straight-sets loss to American qualifier Bethanie Mattek-Sands. Marin Cilic, one of the dark horses to win the title, almost followed Ivanovic out of the competition, but eventually found just enough to beat Ricardas Berankis in a five-set thriller on Centre Court.(n)
